key_points: Rylee McCollum, a U.S. service member, was killed in the Afghanistan airport attack on Aug. 26.
McCollum's widow, Jiennah, gave birth to their daughter, Levi Rylee Rose McCollum, on Sept. 13 in San Diego.
Levi Rylee Rose McCollum weighed 8 lbs., 10 oz. at birth.
The birth was announced on Facebook by both Jiennah and her mother, Jill Miller Crayton.
McCollum, a 20-year-old lance corporal, died along with more than 100 civilians in the attack.
The attack was claimed by ISIS-K, a branch of the Islamic State.
Jiennah mourned her husband's death in an emotional Facebook post, mentioning his absence for their daughter.
A GoFundMe for McCollum's family and daughter's upbringing has raised over $675,000.
Rylee McCollum had aspired to join the Marines since he was three years old.
The attack resulted in at least 20 Marines wounded and more than 170 people killed.
